cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the recovery of signals from subsampled and permuted measurements, which is a problem in diverse fields of data science and machine learning. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories. 

cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely category as the paper deals with linear transformations and algebraic theory, which are closely related to information theory. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also likely as the paper discusses the recovery of signals from subsampled and permuted measurements, which is a common problem in machine learning. 

cs.CV (Computer Vision) is another possible category as the paper mentions image registration under affine transformations, which is a common problem in computer vision. 

cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is a possible category as the paper discusses dynamic programming based algorithms. 

cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is a less likely category, but still possible as the paper deals with subsampled and permuted measurements, which are common in network analysis.
